revised_title: Late Holocene Carbon Flux in the Northeast Atlantic: Benthic Geochemical Record
tldr: This study examines the vertical flux of organic carbon from the euphotic zone to the sediment-water interface in the northeast Atlantic. The researchers used a combination of techniques, including the disequilibrium between members of the uranium decay series, to estimate the organic carbon flux. The results reveal a strong spatial and temporal signal in the carbon flux through the deep sea, providing insight into the fate of carbon in the northeast Atlantic.
